Issues.Title: Replace String.CompareOrdinal to string.Equals
Issues.Body:
We can use `string.Equals(string1, string2, StringComparison.Ordinal)` to check for equality, see https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/csharp/how-to/compare-strings and https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/standard/base-types/best-practices-strings

> Use the [String.Compare](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.string.compare) and [String.CompareTo](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.string.compareto) methods to sort strings, not to check for equality.

- https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/pull/7500
- https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/pull/7680
- https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/pull/7833
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Replace String.CompareOrdinal to string.Equals" (#7834)

Issues.Title: Replace String.CompareOrdinal to string.Equals Part 3
Issues.Body:
## Description

We can use `string.Equals(string1, string2, StringComparison.Ordinal)` to check for equality, see https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/csharp/how-to/compare-strings and https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/standard/base-types/best-practices-strings

> Use the [String.Compare](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.string.compare) and [String.CompareTo](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.string.compareto) methods to sort strings, not to check for equality.

Reference: https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/issues/7834

## Customer Impact

Small performance improvements

## Regression

None.

## Testing

Just CI.

## Risk

Low.

Issues.Title: GroupStyle cause ListBox to use the wrong ItemPanel
Issues.Body:
### Description

When adding item to a **empty** `ListBox`, if a `GroupStyle` is defined, `ListBox` will use the GroupStyle's `ItemPanelTemplate` instead of its own. It's important to note that no grouping or sorting is applied to the `ListBox`.

### Reproduction Steps

Build and Run the Project 
[DBSolution.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/files/11471012/DBSolution.zip)
Right Click to open the context menu. Choose "Add"
Take a look in the Visual Tree.

### Expected behavior

WrapPanel is used.
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/assets/52592373/bbf367e4-b84f-4b55-804c-eae6ed31c23b)

### Actual behavior

But StackPanel is used instead
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/assets/52592373/0a7615e7-6cd5-4c56-abb1-3cfc4bece01f)

### Regression?

_No response_

### Known Workarounds

- The ListBox is not empty
If the ItemsSource provided to the ListBox already have item inside.
- Reinitalize the ListBox after adding items
In the project provided, add some items to the ListBox then switch to a different tab and switch back.

The ListBox will be reintialize and use the correct PanelTemplate in these cases.

### Impact

_No response_

### Configuration

.NET 7.0 both Debug and Release Build
Windows 10 Home 19045.2965
x64
Do you know whether it is specific to that configuration? **No**

### Other information

Refereshing the Collection via `CollectionViewSource.GetDefaultView()` doesn't seen to affect anthing

My original [reddit post](https://www.reddit.com/r/csharp/comments/13ae6u6/help_listbox_applying_the_wrong_itempaneltemplate) about the issue. Someone suggested making a bug report
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "GroupStyle cause ListBox to use the wrong ItemPanel" (#7828)

Issues.Title: WPF .NET framework 4.8.1 fails to launch application
Issues.Body:
### Description

When you try to start application it's closed instantly without showing UI window.

- Only happens for 4.8.1 target. 
- 4.8 and below works as expected. 
- .NET core works as expected.

### Reproduction Steps

1. Create WPF application from default templates, which targets .NET framework 4.8.1.
2. Start application.

### Expected behavior

Run and show application window.

### Actual behavior

Instantly closes application.

### Regression?

_No response_

### Known Workarounds

_No response_

### Impact

_No response_

### Configuration

.NET 4.8.1

### Other information

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "WPF .NET framework 4.8.1 fails to launch application" (#7811)

Issues.Title: DataGrid in edit mode with TabControl cause crash
Issues.Body:
### Description

When editing a DataGrid textbox in edit mode, right-clicking to display a context menu, and then switching the DataGrid item source by clicking on a tab, and then if you double-click to enter the edit mode of one cell, and then double-click another cell in an attempt to enter edit mode, it will inevitably crash.


### Reproduction Steps

run the attached project 

double click first cell to enter edit mode
right click to popup the context menu
click tab2 to switch
double click first row cell to enter edit mode
double click second cell
crash


[DataGridBug.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/files/11420834/DataGridBug.zip)


### Expected behavior

enter the edit mode of the second cell

### Actual behavior

Crash

### Regression?

_No response_

### Known Workarounds

_No response_

### Impact

_No response_

### Configuration

.net framework 4.7.2 both x86 and x64

### Other information

It seems "right click" will register an AutomationPeer event on datagrid.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "DataGrid in edit mode with TabControl cause crash" (#7810)

Issues.Title: [API Proposal]: Change MenuAutomationPeer/ContextMenuAutomationPeer to inherite from ItemsControlAutomationPeer
Issues.Body:
### Background and motivation

I was asked to create this API proposal for, PR #7335

For automation of UI-Tests we need to get access to menu items that are grouped (#6530). At the moment this is not possible because ``GroupItemAutomationPeer`` only creates automation peers for its children if the parent peer container is type of ``ItemsControlAutomationPeer``. 

### API Proposal

Change inheritance of following types

```c#
namespace System.Windows.Automation.Peers
{
-    public class MenuAutomationPeer : FrameworkElementAutomationPeer
+    public class MenuAutomationPeer : ItemsControlAutomationPeer
    {
    }

-    public class ContextMenuAutomationPeer : FrameworkElementAutomationPeer
+    public class ContextMenuAutomationPeer : ItemsControlAutomationPeer
    {
    }

-    public class MenuItemAutomationPeer : FrameworkElementAutomationPeer, IExpandCollapseProvider, IInvokeProvider, IToggleProvider
+    public class MenuItemAutomationPeer : ItemsControlAutomationPeer, IExpandCollapseProvider, IInvokeProvider, IToggleProvider
    {
    }
```


### API Usage

This change only effects how ``GroupItemAutomationPeer`` handles menu items. The API is used by tools like Ranorex for automated UI testing. Finally The children of an menu item group should be visible in the automation tree.

### Alternative Designs

None

### Risks

None
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[API Proposal]: Change MenuAutomationPeer/ContextMenuAutomationPeer to inherite from ItemsControlAutomationPeer" (#7808)
